Journey so far

2018-present

Leibniz Universität Hannover, Germany

In 2018 I joined the PhD program in Physics offered by the Institut für Theoretische Physik at LUH with funding from DAAD. I was lucky to have an understanding supervisor in Olaf Lechtenfeld who has helped me write 3 research papers so far. I feel confident about finishing my PhD dissertation next year before the funding expires with a few more research papers in hand. I have also attended several conferences and summer schools in and around Germany so far. In particular, the yearly Saalburg Summer Schools have been very helpful in providing a first hand experience of several research avenues of modern era.

2015-2018

Indian Institute of Science Education & Research, Kolkata, India

I then enrolled in the Integrated PhD program of the Deparment of Physical Sciences at IISER-K in order to get a proper training as far the courseworks are concerned. This proved greatly beneficial for me as I was able to complete several courses, including some from the Mathematics department, that were offered by very competent faculty members over an intensive 3 year period. I also further collaborated with Biswajit Chakrabarty by visiting S N Bose Centre during summer breaks to produce 2 more research papers. I finally graduated from IISER-K in 2018 with a Masters degree to continue a PhD program in Germany.

2010-2015

Indian Institute of Technology (BHU), Varanasi, India

I first joined the 5 year dual-degree (Bachelor+Master) program of the Department of Biochemical Engineering at IIT(BHU) with an aim of persuing research in Biotechnology. It was, however, by the end of 2nd year that I discovered my passion for theoretical physics. Having already spend 2 years there I decided to finish the degree program while learning the various physics subjects on my own during spare times. I later came in contact with Biswajit Chakraborty with whom I published my first research article before graduating in 2015. Prof. Chakrabarty had a very significant impact on my research career and I would go on to publish more papers with him later.
